10% Federal Income

12.4% Social Security
.9% Health Care

28.79% total taxes

I also have a restaurant job but I only make about $5,000 a year so I'm in the sub $9,275 tax bracket.

comments.author: @wrxzboost
comments.text:
you shouldn't be creating a video like this. you clearly don't have much knowledge about taxes.

if you make more than $451,051 in a tax year, you DO NOT pay 39.6% on the entire amount. you pay 10% on the first $9,275, then you pay 15% on $28,374, then 25% on $54,099 and so on. you would only pay 39.6% on any amount OVER $451,050. makes sense kid?
